DOC.brief_summary: So far, only limited data is available regarding the natural course in Congenital Cataract Facial Dysmorphism Neuropathy Syndrome (CCFDN) and sporadic and hereditary inclusion body myopathies (IBM). Several criteria and outcome measures have led to contradicting results. The investigators want to retrospectively assess the natural course of the disease in CCFDN and IBM patients according to the data recorded during clinical routine visits.
DOC.brief_title: Natural History in CCFDN and IBM Syndromes
DOC.detailed_description: We wanted to assess the natural course in Congenital Cataract Facial Dysmorphism Neuropathy Syndrome (CCFDN) and sporadic and hereditary inclusion body myopathies (IBM) over 10 years to gain new insights in both conditions.
DOC.criteria: Clinical and/or genetic diagnosis of Congenital Cataract Facial Dysmorphism Neuropathy Syndrome (CCFDN) and sporadic and hereditary inclusion body myopathies (IBM) Additional neuromuscular diseases
